@graph.headline: Mashed Potato and Poblano Flautas (Salud, Vegan Mexican Cookbook)

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Mashed Potato and Poblano Flautas
@graph.description: These crispy golden flautas are filled with mashed potatoes spiced with poblano peppers, garlic, onion, and cumin. They can be baked or pan fried to a crisp.
recipeIngredient: 2  Russet potatoes, baked or microwaved (skins discarded)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Lightly spray a nonstick baking sheet with a nonstick cooking spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Lightly spray a nonstick baking sheet with a nonstick cooking spray.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion and poblano chile for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the onion is translucent. Add the cumin seeds, salt, pepper, and garlic. Sauté 4 more minutes. Remove from the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion and poblano chile for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the onion is translucent. Add the cumin seeds, salt, pepper, and garlic. Sauté 4 more minutes. Remove from the heat.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mix together the onion mixture, cooked potato, and almond milk. Mash well. Some visible chunks are fine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, mix together the onion mixture, cooked potato, and almond milk. Mash well. Some visible chunks are fine.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the tortillas until they are pliable.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the tortillas until they are pliable.

recipeInstructions.text: To assemble the flautas, place 2 tbsp. of potato filling in each tortilla and roll it up tightly. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the tortillas are rolled up.
recipeInstructions.name: To assemble the flautas, place 2 tbsp. of potato filling in each tortilla and roll it up tightly. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the tortillas are rolled up.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray the flautas with nonstick cooking spray and place in the oven. Bake 10 to 12 minutes , or until the edges of the tortillas are brown and crispy. Turn the pan halfway through the cooking time for even cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly spray the flautas with nonstick cooking spray and place in the oven. Bake 10 to 12 minutes , or until the edges of the tortillas are brown and crispy. Turn the pan halfway through the cooking time for even cooking.

@graph.keywords: mashed potato flautas, poblano flautas, vegan flautas
